data.name: bot.log
data.description:
Bot webhooks also include events for bot logs, providing detailed information about certain failure modes.

There are several warnings/errors that can trigger bot.log events:
- Failure to send chat messages

Read more: https://docs.recall.ai/docs/bot-status-change-events#bot-logs

1.description: Event emitted for bot logs

data.description: The data payload of the log event

bot_id.description: The unique identifier of the bot (present for all but async transcription job logs)
bot_id.title: Bot ID

job_id.description: The unique identifier of the job (present for async transcription job logs)
job_id.title: Job ID

created_at.description: The timestamp when the log was created
created_at.title: Created At

level.description: The severity level of the log
level.title: Log Level

message.description: The content of the log message
message.title: Log Message

data.title: Event Data

1.title: Bot Log Event

data.name: bot.output_log
data.description:
Bot webhooks also include events for bot logs, providing detailed information about certain failure modes.

There are several warnings/errors that can trigger bot.output_log events:
- Real-time transcription errors (https://docs.recall.ai/docs/real-time-transcription#transcription-errors)
- Zoom OAuth integration warnings
- RTMP connection errors

Read more: https://docs.recall.ai/docs/bot-status-change-events#bot-logs

1.description: Event emitted for bot output logs

data.description: The data payload of the log event

bot_id.description: The unique identifier of the bot (present for all but async transcription job logs)
bot_id.title: Bot ID

job_id.description: The unique identifier of the job (present for async transcription job logs)
job_id.title: Job ID

created_at.description: The timestamp when the log was created
created_at.title: Created At

level.description: The severity level of the log
level.title: Log Level

message.description: The content of the log message
message.title: Log Message

data.title: Event Data

1.title: Bot Output Log Event

data.name: bot.status_change
data.description:
Recall uses bot status changes to capture the lifecycle of a bot.
These status changes are exposed through webhooks, which your application can use to create a real-time experience or react to asynchronous events outside of the API request cycle. 

Read more: https://docs.recall.ai/v1.10/docs/bot-status-change-events#/events

1.description: Event emitted when a bot's status changes

data.description: The data payload of the status change event

status.description: The status information of the bot

code.description: The status code of the bot
code.title: Status Code

created_at.description: The timestamp when the status was created
created_at.title: Created At

status.title: Status Details

data.title: Event Data

1.title: Bot Status Change Event

data.name: calendar.sync_events
data.description:
This webhook is sent whenever events on a calendar have been updated.
You should re-fetch the calendar events for this calendar via List Calendar Events. You can choose to do either a full sync or use the last_updated_ts field in the payload (pass as updated_at__gte query parameter) to do an incremental sync of events associated with the calendar on your end.

Read more: https://docs.recall.ai/docs/calendar-v2-webhooks#calendar-sync-events

1.description: Event emitted when a calendar syncs its events

data.description: The data payload of the calendar sync event

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar
calendar_id.title: Calendar ID

last_updated_ts.description: The timestamp of when the calendar was last synced
last_updated_ts.title: Timestamp of last sync

data.title: Event Data

1.title: Calendar Sync Events

data.name: calendar.update
data.description:
This webhook is sent whenever the calendar's data changes (for instance, when status becomes disconnected).
You should re-fetch the calendar via Retrieve Calendar to get the latest state.

Read more: https://docs.recall.ai/docs/calendar-v2-webhooks#calendar-update

1.description: Event emitted when a calendar is updated

data.description: The data payload of the calendar update event

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar
calendar_id.title: Calendar ID

data.title: Event Data

1.title: Calendar Update Event
